game

Class MovingEntity

  • java.lang.Object
    • abstract_classes.Entity
      • abstract_classes.MovingEntity

  • public abstract class MovingEntity
extends Entity
    This class will represent an Entity with the ability to move
    Author:
    Alexander J Mills

    • Constructor Detail

      • MovingEntity

        public MovingEntity(org.jsfml.graphics.RenderWindow window,
                    java.lang.String name,
                    int topLeftX,
                    int topLeftY,
                    int width,
                    int height)
        Creates a new moving entity, with a given name
        Parameters:
        window - - RenderWindow in which the Entity will be displayed
        name - - String name for the Entity
        topLeftX - - int X position of the top left of the entity
        topLeftY - - int Y position of the top left of the entity
        width - - int width
        height - - int height
        transformable - - Transformable obj

    • Method Detail

      • move

        public void move()
        Implementation of move function. Will check for collisions if child implements InteractingEntity and then move if possible

      • setSpeed

        public void setSpeed(org.jsfml.system.Vector2i speed)
        Set speed
        Parameters:
        speed - - Vector2i representing the speed of the entity in the x and y planes

      • getSpeed

        public org.jsfml.system.Vector2i getSpeed()
        Get the entities speed
        Returns:
        Vector2i value representing the speed in two dimensional space

      • setSpeedMultiplier

        public void setSpeedMultiplier(float multiplier)
        Sets the speed multiplier for the Entity. This is used to scale the speed in both directions. Should probably only use on a class by class basis
        Parameters:
        multiplier - - float value
